channel.title: Comments on: Pink Lady Apple, Rhubarb and Cinnamon Jam

item.title: By: Sarah
item.dc:creator: Sarah
item.description: Great recipe! I've made it three times now, first for myself, and twice recently to put jars into Xmas hampers for family. Each time it has been a resounding success (except that the second time my damn candy thermometer broke in the mix, leaving glass shards through it. A major disappointment as I think that was my best jam batch so far, but it had to be discarded. Not the fault of the recipe though!). Anyway, just wanted to say thank you for sharing this great recipe - it's fantastic to find a jam that is easy to make and not sickly sweet.
item.content:encoded: Great recipe! I’ve made it three times now, first for myself, and twice recently to put jars into Xmas hampers for family. Each time it has been a resounding success (except that the second time my damn candy thermometer broke in the mix, leaving glass shards through it. A major disappointment as I think that was my best jam batch so far, but it had to be discarded. Not the fault of the recipe though!). Anyway, just wanted to say thank you for sharing this great recipe – it’s fantastic to find a jam that is easy to make and not sickly sweet.

item.title: By: Andrea Sinclair
item.dc:creator: Andrea Sinclair
item.description: Just made a double batch - so yummy. I didn't have enough rhubarb, so I just used more pink lady apples to get the right quantity of fruit. Thank you so much for this lovely recipe!
item.content:encoded: Just made a double batch – so yummy. I didn’t have enough rhubarb, so I just used more pink lady apples to get the right quantity of fruit. Thank you so much for this lovely recipe!

item.title: By: Anita
item.dc:creator: Anita
item.description: Hi Kate - Whoops! Sorry, can't believe I left it out! Feel free to add more cinnamon if you like, but 1 teaspoon is quite subtle and nice. Thanks for visiting!! :)
item.content:encoded: Hi Kate – Whoops! Sorry, can’t believe I left it out! Feel free to add more cinnamon if you like, but 1 teaspoon is quite subtle and nice. Thanks for visiting!! ðŸ™‚

Hi Rosa - Thanks heaps.
Hi Julia - Thanks, I tried to make the jars look sort of homely. :)

item.title: By: Steph
item.dc:creator: Steph
item.description: I love the colour it turns from the rhubarb! Sounds like a combination of flavours that would work together perfectly. Those are adorable jam jars by the way, very cute :)
item.content:encoded: I love the colour it turns from the rhubarb! Sounds like a combination of flavours that would work together perfectly. Those are adorable jam jars by the way, very cute ðŸ™‚
